author: ncsyannex
content: Do people generally store blockchain data in a database (no matter the form) or do they query the data from a node ? I am asking because I am working on a data science project and need to access a lot of data (transactions of certain addresses in 2 years worth of blocks) quickly.

author: ncsyannex
content: But an archive node allows me to query data from inception but I still need to go over the blocks to find what I need, right ?

author: pietjepuk
content: Yes, but syncing your own archive node is the fastest way to query the data you need. And if you need to access the same data repeatedly, store it in your own DB or something.
